Area residents, education leaders, activists, local elected officials and federal judges have decried agents’ actions in residential areas as overly aggressive and, at times, dangerous. This led to a federal judge issuing a temporary restraining order Oct. 9 to curb officers from using aggressive tactics, including tear gas, when they are not under imminent threat.

In Broadview, outside an immigration detention facility, residents have complained of their children feeling the impacts of chemical agents while in their backyards, or even inside their homes. Chicago Public Schools have had to move elementary school recess indoors after tear gas was deployed and teachers have complained of helicopters hovering over their schools, scaring students.

Most recently, schools in north suburban Evanston were impacted. On Friday, Border Patrol agents deployed chemical agents in the city. Citing nearby immigration activities, all schools in the district were placed on lockdown, according to the mayor.
“Let me be extremely clear for all Chicago media: We are NOT targeting schools,” a Department of Homeland Security statement read.
A DHS spokesperson said agents were in the area to arrest five undocumented individuals “whose criminal histories included criminal trespass and multiple illegal entries into the country.”

“A hostile crowd surrounded agents and their vehicle, and began verbally abusing them and spitting on them. As Border patrol arrested one individual, who actively resisted arrest, pepper spray was deployed … to deter the agitator and disperse the crowd,” the spokesperson said.
Allie Harned, a social worker with Chute Middle School in Evanston, said at a news conference Friday that the agents’ actions were unacceptable.

“I witnessed some horror today, a block away from Chute Middle School, and this was awful. There were ICE agents and CPB agents pointing guns at community members, spraying pepper spray in the faces of community members … within eyesight of our Chute Middle School students,” Harned said. “This was terrifying. It was terrifying to our community members. It was terrifying to a student who happened to be in a car and witnessed it. It is not OK.”

Evanston Mayor Daniel Biss said that, in a new strategy, the city's police department is appearing on the scene of immigration arrests, identifying agents by badge number and documenting the impact of their activities on residents.
“There’s only one entity causing serious violence in Evanston right now, and that is the federal government,” Biss told NBC News.

After the Old Irving Park clash drew widespread headlines — and outrage — including over a confrontation between a 67-year-old runner and agents on his street, DHS pushed back on narratives that were circulating. The resident exited the vehicle and uttered an expletive. His hands go up as the brief footage provided by DHS then cuts off. A statement from the man’s running group excoriated DHS for breaking the man’s ribs, accusing them of excessive force.
“HERE’S THE REAL STORY,” the DHS post on X started in all caps. “Border Patrol agents were surrounded and boxed in by a group of agitators.” It then went on to play a brief video clip.
When shown the words in the post, George, a father who lives in the neighborhood and witnessed the incident, laughed.
“Agitators? Brian ran out in his bare feet and Blackhawks pajamas,” he said of his neighbor. “I was wearing a duck costume.”

George, who asked not to use his last name, said he had just returned from the YMCA and he and his two young daughters rushed to change into their Halloween costumes to make it to the nearby parade. When he heard commotion outside, he ran out in his all-yellow costume, repurposed from The Man with the Yellow Hat outfit of Curious George fame.

He described a confusing scene where he could neither tell if someone had been detained nor distinguish immigration agents’ vehicles from that of residents. Looking on and standing beside a vehicle, he was suddenly thrown to the ground by an agent, according to a video reviewed by NBC News. He said he thought he was under arrest, but then, suddenly it all stopped and he got up and moved farther to the side of the street. His head hurt for days and he was treated at urgent care for a mild traumatic brain injury, he said.

George said he wondered why agents didn’t leave sooner to de-escalate the situation. He believes, based on what he saw, they had plenty of space to drive away, despite agents’ claims of being boxed in.
When he returned home, his 5-year-old, who watched the episode from the front door, made a striking comment: “‘Dad, I just don’t understand who the bad guys are.’”
When asked what the most violent episode was that he’s witnessed in his neighborhood, George didn’t hesitate: “1000% this was,” he said of the Oct. 25 event.

Neighborhood resident Brian Kolp, a former Cook County prosecutor and now a private attorney, said he felt immigration agents haven’t been carrying out deportation operations in the highest crime areas of the city.

“Whereas, in Old Irving Park, the worst we could probably do is try to blow them away with our leaf blowers,” Kolp said. “No one around here is in a gang. No one around here is rolling around with any guns. Obviously, in other parts of the city, that’s not necessarily going to be the case.”

Parise questioned the government’s financial justification for its operation in Old Irving Park, which yielded one arrest of an undocumented immigrant but had far-reaching effects on children and other residents.

“What was the return on that? What did you spend to have all those people out there for the day with all of their fake tactical gear and their tear gas and their whatever?” Parise asked. “Also then, what did it take from all the people around here, who are now scared and completely spooked?”

title: Why Does Kim Kardashian’s New Show ‘All's Fair’ Have a 0 on Rotten Tomatoes?
summary: The new Hulu drama series “All’s Fair,” which features an all-star cast led by Kim Kardashian, is making headlines for all the wrong reasons as it continues to be panned by critics.
story: The new Hulu drama series “All’s Fair,” which features an all-star cast led by Kim Kardashian, is making headlines for all the wrong reasons as it continues to be panned by critics.

“All’s Fair” premiered its first three episodes on the streaming platform Nov. 4, introducing viewers to a group of female divorce attorneys who decide to leave their firm, run by men, and open their own practice.

“Fierce, brilliant, and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets, and shifting allegiances— both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. In a world where money talks and love is a battleground, these women don’t just play the game—they change it,” the description reads. The legal drama, co-created by Ryan Murphy and his “Grotesquerie” collaborators Jon Robin Baitz and Joe Baken, also stars Sarah Paulson, Glenn Close, Niecy Nash, Naomi Watts and Teyana Taylor.

But despite all the talented names in front of and behind the camera, the series debuted on Rotten Tomatoes with a 0% score from critics, who wrote mostly scathing reviews about the show’s plot, writing and Kardashian’s performance.

While critics seem aligned on their opinions of “All’s Fair” so far, the audience score has been somewhat more favorable. Read on to hear what television critics and viewers have been saying about the trending series.
What Have Critics Said About ‘All’s Fair’?
Since it arrived on Hulu, the reviews for “All’s Fair”  have been overwhelmingly negative. Multiple critics have pointed out the disjointed tone and thin plot.

In her review for Time, Judy Berman wrote, in part, “I can say that, whether it means to be or not, 'All’s Fair' is both reminiscent of some of the small screen’s biggest female-focused hits and unlike anything I’ve seen on TV before.”

That’s not a compliment. She later described the series as “a 2010s Shonda Rhimes procedural on steroid shots and Goop supplements, if everyone in the writers’ room had been freshly lobotomized. 'All’s Fair' is 'The First Wives Club' for psychopaths. 'All’s Fair' is a multigenerational, workplace 'Sex and the City,' if the sex were all talk and the city irrelevant and the humor not necessarily intentional.”

New York Magazine’s Vulture critic Roxana Hadadi called out Murphy in her review. “At his best, Murphy is a connoisseur of low culture, a maestro of story lines that play out at a buzzsaw pace, a sculptor of characters who spit out corrosive one-liners and gnaw through scenery, an architect of goofy sex scenes, and a mastermind at presenting exploitation as empowerment,” she said. “'All’s Fair' is cotton-candy TV: sticky, airy, and, once it’s all gone, both satisfying and nausea inducing.”
But there were some positives, as Hadadi wrote that “All’s Fair” has moments when it is reminiscent of other Murphy series like “Nip/Tuck,” “9-1-1” and “Doctor Odyssey.”
Kaleigh Donaldson of “The Wrap” was less forgiving, labeling the show “terrible” before pointing out flaws in the script and Kardashian’s acting.

“There are lines of dialogue here so bad that one wonders if the script ever got past a sketched-out first draft on the back of a napkin. When it’s not lazy exposition, it’s painfully stretched attempts at gif-ready one-liners,” Donaldson said. She also said Kardashian’s inclusion in the series was “stunt casting.”

Kelly Lawler of USA Today flat-out called it “the worst TV show of the year” in her headline and Variety’s Angie Han said it was “unforgivably dull.” The Guardian’s Lucy Mangan gave it zero out of five stars.
The one critic who wrote a complimentary review: Decider’s Joel Keller, who recommended his readers stream the series. His review also bumped the show up to a 6% score on Rotten Tomatoes.

“When you cram a show like 'All’s Fair' with so many top-notch actors (and, while Kim K. isn’t exactly Watts, Nash or Close-level in the acting department, she holds her own), and then stuff each episode with cases involving huge guest stars, you can’t help but make a show watchable,” he said. Keller also pointed out there were comedic moments in the show that he enjoyed.
He concluded, “'All’s Fair' is over the top and campy as hell, but it also knows it’s both of these things, which is why the show and the cases the firm deals with are going to be fun to watch.”
What Have Fans Said About ‘All’s Fair’?
While critics voiced their opinions, hundreds of viewers commented on Rotten Tomatoes to share their thoughts, too. The audience score was mixed, hovering around 61% as of Nov. 5.

One fan left a five-star review and said, “People are such haters. Such a fun watch with great talent. Keyboard warriors and trolls seem to basing their ratings based off what they think of the Kardashians and Kim without giving merit to her actual talent, skill and dedication to every craft shes put hands on. If you know you know and if you dont know, take your hate elsewhere.”

Another commented, “I love it, I feel it’s a very clever show. I love the characters in their individuality and how they all bring a different flavor to every episode. I had expectations and I feel glad they didn’t disappoint. Ryan Murphy never disappoints.”
A third agreed about the show’s premise, writing, “Personally I think it is a powerhouse display of women and law and is very interesting and entertaining.”
Many said they appreciated the campy sense of humor in “All’s Fair” and were looking forward to the rest of the season.

“All Fair’s Will Be The People’s Champ! It’s (what we’re) missing on television. It’s funny, fashion forward, campy, glamorous, and filled with shade and reads!! Reviews are being tough but I think the people will enjoy it! It’s something new and original,” one person wrote. “I’m tired of the reboot era.”
However, some agreed with the critics.

One one-star review from a viewer read, “All’s Fair tries to present itself as bold and provocative, but it ends up being tone-deaf and, at times, outright offensive. In the current state of the world, where empathy and awareness should be at the forefront of storytelling, the show’s approach feels careless and disconnected. Instead of challenging viewers to think critically, it relies on exaggerated stereotypes and shallow shock value. What could have been a relevant commentary on justice and social dynamics turns into a spectacle that trivializes serious issues. Art has the power to provoke, but it also carries responsibility. All’s Fair forgets that balance — and the result is a show that feels out of touch with the moment we’re living in.”

Another said that the promising concept wasn’t executed properly. “While this series boasts impeccable styling and a stellar cast, it is completely let down by the awkwardly abrupt writing, delivery, and poor direction. As a result, each scene feels (labored), and the actors showcase their unique skills at a rather jarring, manufactured and superficial level. The concept had great potential — backed by a solid budget. It is clear something wasn’t working behind the scenes and, in this instance, it may cost Ryan Murphy the attention of his otherwise usually loyal audience.”

title: What Happened to Miss Mexico During Miss Universe Event in Thailand? Controversy, Explained
summary: A Miss Universe executive singled out and criticized one contestant at an event in Thailand, causing an international controversy after the video went viral
story: A Miss Universe executive singled out and criticized one contestant at an event in Thailand, causing an international controversy after the video went viral.

Ahead of the 74th Miss Universe competition, which takes place in Bangkok later this month, contestants gathered in Thailand over the past few days. Per the schedule, delegates arrived Nov. 2 ahead of a sashing ceremony, which was set for Nov. 5.
As part of the schedule of events, contestants attended a talk from Nawat Itsaragrisil, a Thai businessman and national director of Miss Universe Thailand.
While livestreaming the event on Facebook, the Miss Universe Thailand organization captured a heated exchange between Itsaragrisil and Miss Universe Mexico titleholder Fatima Bosch.
What happened, and how did the Miss Universe organization respond? Here's everything we know so far.
Itsaragrisil and Bosch's Argument Escalated Quickly

While speaking to Miss Universe contestants, Itsaragrisil appeared  to single out Bosch for not participating in certain promotional activities for the pageant and its host country. He also criticized the national director of Mexico's Miss Universe organization.
“If you follow the order from your national director, you are dumb,” he said.
He continued to criticize not posting about the host country and the pageant before Bosch again spoke up.
Bosch, who spoke calmly throughout the interaction, seemed to upset Itsaragrisil as she attempted to share her perspective.
"Not about you," he said.
"I didn't give you opportunity to talk. Please keep polite. I still talking. Listen," he added as the exchange continued.
When Itsaragrisil asked why Bosch stood up to talk while he's "talking to everybody," she said, "Because I have a voice."
When Bosch said Itsaragrisil was "not respecting me as a woman," he grew increasingly frustrated and called for security.
The other women in the room were disturbed by the tense interaction and said, "No," as Itsaragrisil called for security.
Meanwhile, Bosch could be heard saying, “I am here representing my country, and it is not my fault that you have problems with my organization.”
The other women in the room then got up to follow Bosch out and Itsaragrisil instructed them to "sit down" if they wanted to continue in the contest.
Bosch Spoke to Reporters After the Event
Outside of the event, Bosch expressed disappointment with the way she had been treated. In a video interview that was shared by the Miami Herald, she said Itsaragrisil was "not respectful."

"He called me dumb because he have problems with the organization. And I think that's not fair because I'm here and I do everything OK. I don't mess with anyone. I just try to be kind. I'm trying to give my best and he just shot me and he just said to me and shut up and a lot of different things," she said.
Bosch explained that she and her fellow contestants are "empowered women" with a powerful "platform."
"And no one can shut our voice and no one will do that to me," she said.
How the Miss Universe Mexico Organization Responded
Following the incident, the official Miss Universe Mexico Instagram account expressed its support for Bosch.

"Mexican women always gettin up. We will always raise our face and soul high, because the voice of @fatimaboschfdz carries with it the voice of women of the world. Today we don’t only speak for Mexico, we speak for all those who deserve respect, dignity and recognition. Thank you to all the fans, media, and content creators who have come together to stand up for what’s right. Mexico does not shut up. Mexico is rising up," the post read.
Miss Universe's President Released a Statement Condemning Itsaragrisil's Actions
Miss Universe Organization President Raúl Rocha responded to the viral moment by filming a video message condemning Itsaragrisil’s treatment of Bosch.

"I will not allow the values of respect and dignity toward women to be violated. Unfortunately, Nawat has forgotten the true meaning of what it means to be a genuine host. It means to demonstrate to all delegates of all countries that he as a host, he has the obligation to serve them, assist them and support them, and to ensure they have a unique life experience filled with kindness and courtesy so that they may enjoy and take from Thailand the best memories of their lives, in an atmosphere of healthy and friendly competition," he said.
Rocha expressed his "great indignation toward Nawat" and said he "humiliated, insulted and he showed a lack of respect" toward Bosch.
Rocha said Itsaragrisil has a "constant desire to be the center of attention" and urged him to change his approach while speaking with members of the Miss Universe organization and others.
“Nawat you need to stop. Every woman in the world should be respected,” he added.

"I will not allow any of them to be attacked and humiliated as many of them have managed to reach this platform of visibility and voice precisely while trying to overcome situations like these," he said.
Itsaragrisil Responded to the Controversy

Itsaragrisil addressed the controversy with a post on Facebook. While re-sharing a post from the Miss Universe Organization, he added, "Just finished meeting with MUO from Mexico. Thanks so much for understanding and corroborate."

The Miss Universe statement said the organization "reaffirms its commitment to working closely with the host community, the Miss Grand International Organization, and all local partners to ensure the continued success of the 74th Miss Universe competition. Together, we are dedicated to upholding the highest standards of respect, safety, and integrity for all participants, staff, and stakeholders."

Itsaragrisil also seemingly apologized, per footage from an Instagram live re-shared by several Instagram users. In the video, Itsaragrisil said, "If anyone (is) feeling not good, if anyone (is) not comfortable. if anyone (was affected), I do apologize for everyone. But I did talk, apologize to the rest of the girls in the room, about 75 girls in the room already."
Itsaragrisil also expressed frustration that there hasn't been anyone with "authority" for Miss Universe Thailand and said he was meeting with the Miss Universe organization to discuss the situation.

title: Flavor Flav Apologizes For 'DWTS' Mistake That Cost 1 Couple the 1st Perfect Score of the Season
summary: Flavor Flav is coming forward to admit one of the scores he awarded while guest judging "Dancing with the Stars" Nov. 4 was a mistake
story: Flavor Flav is coming forward to admit one of the scores he awarded while guest judging "Dancing with the Stars" Nov. 4 was a mistake.

The former Public Enemy rapper, 66, appeared as a guest judge for the dance competition's Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night, when the eight remaining couple's performed dance routines to classic rock 'n' roll hits.
Social media personality Alix Earle and her pro partner Val Chmerkovskiy danced a paso doble to “Livin’ On a Prayer” by Bon Jovi.
The couple got perfect 10s from all the judges — except for Flavor Flav. He gave the pair a 9, bringing their final score to 39, just shy of a perfect 40.

Earle finished the couple dances tied with "Secret Lives of Mormon Lives" star Whitney Leavitt and her partner Mark Ballas whose paso doble to Ozzy Osbourne's “No More Tears” also received a 39. Leavitt and Ballas received 10s from every judge except Carrie Ann Inaba.
After the live show, the “Flavor of Love” star posted on X and Bluesky that he actually meant to give Earle and Chmerkovskiy a perfect 10 but was foiled by a typo.

"Last nite on #DWTS,,, when judging,,, you hit your score on a computer first,,, then hold up the sign. I accidentally hit 9 for someone and told the crew I meant to hit 10,,, and they said they can’t change it and there’s nothing I can do," Flavor Flav wrote.
"That girl deserved perfect 10s," he added.
Had Flavor Flav given Earle a 10, she and Chmerkovskiy would have been the first couple to receive a perfect score this season.
The hip-hop star, whose real name is William Drayton, also acknowledged his scoring glitch in a post-show interview with Parade. He raved about the level of talent on the show.
"Everybody at home, they think that I’m crazy ... But honestly, seriously, every dance was a 10," he said.

“There was one (dance) that I gave a 9 out on that I wanted to give a 10, but they wouldn’t let me change it. It was the first 9 that I gave out ... I wanted that one to be a 10, but they wouldn't let me change it back," he added.
The rapper also told Parade he apologized to Earle for his mishap.
“I let Alix know that (she deserved a perfect score),” he shared. “She said, ‘Flav it’s OK, it’s a good score.’”

title: Meet the '90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 Days' Season 8 Cast: EXCLUSIVE
summary: "90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 days" is returning. See the trailer and meet the cast.
story: "90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 days" is returning and the show is preparing to introduce viewers to some of its most intriguing couples to date.
Season 8 of the TLC series follows eight Americans as they travel abroad and come face to face with their partners for the first time.

Before the series returns later this year, TODAY.com has an exclusive first look at Season 8, including a trailer and an introduction to the eight couples who are merging their lives together following a long-distance relationship.
Here's everything you need to know.
When Does Season 8 Premiere?
Season 8 of "90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 days" hits TLC on Sunday, Dec. 7 at 8 p.m. ET/PT.
See the Trailer for the New Season
A new trailer for Season 8 of “90 Day Fiancé: Before the 90 days” introduces viewers to the eight couples who are about to encounter some major cultural differences when they meet for the first time.
At the beginning of the trailer, several participants tell their friends and family about their partners and drop the news that they've never actually met in person.

Forrest, a 32-year-old from Oregon, reveals that his long-distance partner Sheena, a 40-year-old who lives in the Philippines, has access to his every move via security cameras in his house. When he travels to meet his love in person, he brings his parents with him.
Emma, a 28-year-old from California seems to be in it to win it in her relationship with Ziad, a 27-year-old from Morocco.
"I am not leaving until there is a ring on my finger," she declares in one scene.
Aviva, a 26-year-old living in Arizona, travels to Belize to meet her partner Stig, 30, and warns him ahead of time that she's "not on birth control."
Aviva says she's "ready to settle down" but isn't sure if Stig is.
"You're thinking about having a baby with your ex," she says in one conversation that takes place in person.
Laura, a 47-year-old who lives in Washington, relocates to Turkey to be with Birkan, 26, and learns that he's experiencing financial struggles.
"You're in a massive amount of debt. How much is it?" she asks in one scene.

This season, Americans will travel to Turkey, Madagascar, Morocco, Belize, the Philippines and Nigeria to meet their partners. Throughout the experiment, they will encounter judgment from their families, secrets and drama.
This season also features a familiar face: Elise, who appeared on "90 Day: Hunt for Love."
Meet the Season 8 Cast and Couples

"Legally married … yet meeting for the first time! Jovon and Annalyn’s six-year online romance began on Filipino Cupid and culminated in a virtual wedding during the pandemic. Now, for the first time, the couple is preparing to meet in person. But with strong personalities and very different expectations around money, lifestyle, and gender roles, their first in-person chapter as husband and wife may be far more complicated than they ever imagined."

"After two years of online connection sparked by a social media video, Aviva is finally taking the leap, traveling to Belize to meet her boyfriend Stig, a famous rapper known to his fans as Stig Da Artist, for the first time in person. Aviva is ready for forever, but Stig, ever popular with the ladies, has a constant swirl of rumors around him, causing Aviva and those closest to her to doubt whether he can fully commit. With trust issues looming, can their love survive the spotlight?"

"Laura and Birkan’s whirlwind romance began on social media and after just a few short weeks, they were already talking about marriage. She’s a fun-loving and active romantasy novel enthusiast, and Birkan is quiet and philosophical, with a mysterious past. Laura’s doubters include her parents, worried she’s making a mistake, and her best friend Michal, who might be secretly in love with her. Despite all that, plus a 20-year age gap, Laura is risking it all for love."

"Emma met Ziad on an international dating app and was quickly swept up by his charm. Now, she’s flying to Morocco determined to leave with a ring on her finger, but she’s hiding a past engagement to another Moroccan man. And Emma may not be the only one keeping secrets, as Ziad’s behavior sparks doubts, making her question whether their love story is really what it seems."

"After seven years of long-distance love, and Sheena watching Forrest’s daily life through his home security cameras, the couple, both virgins, are finally meeting in person. But with Forrest’s parents joining the trip to investigate the red flags, especially around Sheena’s mysterious family, their long-awaited reunion may be more tense than romantic."

"Rick is a jack-of-all-trades and a divorced single dad who believes he’s finally found the right woman to complete his family, Trisha, a fiery midwife from Madagascar. They’ve been planning a future together, but trust issues loom large after Trisha recently ghosted him, leaving their in-person relationship off to a rocky start."

"Lisa, a spontaneous, open-hearted woman with a colorful romantic history, is ready to fly across the world to meet Daniel, a Nigerian man she fell in love with after he reached out to her on social media. But Lisa is keeping a big secret — she’s been married five times and has spent the last 21 years living as a lesbian. Unsure whether Daniel and his conservative family will accept her past, and with questions swirling about money and trust, Lisa’s shot at love this time could be her most explosive yet."

"Elise, a glamorous Miami real estate agent, met Joshua, a yacht broker from Sydney, through Instagram. Five months later, they’re finally meeting in person. But with Elise’s history of broken engagements and her resolve not to disappoint her family again, combined with Josh’s thrill-seeking lifestyle and friends on both sides sounding alarms, this whirlwind romance could end in smooth sailing or a spectacular wipeout."

title: Tom Bergeron Will Return to ‘Dancing with the Stars’ 5 Years After Sudden Exit
summary: Former "Dancing with the Stars" host Tom Bergeron will return to the show as a guest judge.
story: Tom Bergeron is putting his dancing shoes back on.
The former host of “Dancing with the Stars” will return to the hit ABC series, now in Season 34, for its Nov. 11 episode. He’ll appear as a guest judge to help celebrate the show's 20th anniversary.
“I’m anticipating that it’s going to be a wonderfully emotional, nostalgic night,” Bergeron told TV Insider.

“In the audience will be a number of past champions and competitors," he added. "There’s a special dance challenge that is going to factor into the anniversary night that will evoke even more nostalgia. It’s going to be great. And I’ll tell you, it’s so much fun to watch my friends do the work. I don’t have to throw to commercials. I don’t have to worry about the timing.”

Bergeron also said he will happily play second fiddle to current co-host Alfonso Ribeiro, who competed on the show in 2014 before becoming a host in 2022. Julianne Hough joined as his co-host in 2023.

“I’ll be respectful and sensitive of what Alfonso has to deal with, ’cause I’ve been there,” he said. “But I’m just looking forward to being in an environment surrounded by people I really care about on live television, where there’s no second take. It’s my happy place.”
As for what viewers can expect to see from Bergeron at the judges' table?
“It’s going to be very similar to my hosting style: somewhat loose and unpredictable,” he said.
Why Did Tom Bergeron Leave 'Dancing with the Stars'?

Bergeron was the original co-host of “Dancing with the Stars” when it premiered in 2005. He remained in the role, winning one Emmy for his work on the show, until he left the series in 2020 after he objected to the casting of former White House press secretary Sean Spicer.
Bergeron, who was replaced at the time by Tyra Banks, said he had previously been assured no political figures would compete on the show.
“And I said, ‘Guys, this is exactly what we said we wouldn’t do,’” Bergeron said of his reaction to the casting during a 2023 appearance on dancer Cheryl Burke's “Sex, Lies, and Spray Tans” podcast.

“And I would have responded the same way if they had booked Hillary Clinton, whom I voted for. ‘Don’t go there. This is, you know, not the right time. Play to our strengths. Be the show that gives people a break from all this bulls---.’ So, I was furious,” he added.
After Spicer was cast in 2019, Bergeron posted his disapproval in a since-deleted post on Twitter, now X.

“A few months ago, during a lunch with DWTS’ new Executive Producer, I offered suggestions for Season 28,” Bergeron wrote. “Chief among them was my hope that DWTS, in its return following an unprecedented year-long hiatus, would be a joyful respite from our exhausting political climate and free of inevitably divisive bookings from ANY party affiliations. I left that lunch convinced we were in agreement.”
He said the casting decision was not his to make.

“It is the prerogative of the producers, in partnership with the network, to make whatever decisions they feel are in the best long term interests of the franchise,” he wrote. “We can agree to disagree, as we do now, but ultimately it’s their call. I’ll leave it to them to answer any further questions about those decisions.”

title: Bunnie Xo Shares Her 7 Mugshots and Why She’s ‘Not Ashamed of These Photos’
summary: Bunnie Xo has an inspiring message for anyone who’s struggling right now.
story: Bunnie Xo has an inspiring message for anyone who’s struggling right now.

While she prepares to release in February her new memoir, “Stripped Down,” the podcaster took a walk down memory lane to revisit pivotal, yet challenging moments that brought her to where she is today.
In a Nov. 4 Instagram post, Bunnie Xo shared her seven mugshots and reflected on her journey so far.

“Looking at the first one, I just couldn’t believe what a baby I was. I was 19 , already living on the streets of Vegas for 5 years, couch to couch, or with whatever boyfriend would let me stay. By then I’d already lost three babies,” she captioned the post. “As the pics go on the eyes only get more sad, more broken & more intoxicated.”
Bunnie said she asked her lawyer to share all of her mugshots with her for an idea for book-tour merch. The experience of looking at all of them brought up a lot of emotions, she said.

“The fact that I’m smiling in some of these will let you kno just how disconnected I was from myself & my emotions,” she wrote. “I look at those photos now & just want to hug that little girl. She thought surviving meant hyper independence, fighting in the streets, barking loud & biting even harder.”
Bunnie said her last mugshot was taken when she was 26 years old. She said she was arrested for soliciting an undercover cop at a casino.

“I can still see the drugs in my skin, the bloodshot eyes, the hollow look that comes when you’ve stopped caring if you wake up tomorrow. I was deep in addiction, lost in survival mode. Add in a splash of perpetual victim mentality & it was a recipe for disaster,” she wrote.
The podcaster, who is married to country musician Jelly Roll, said she eventually decided that she wanted a different life for herself.

“I got sick. Sick of humiliating myself, sick of always having to start over & sick of who I was as a human. I had to stop pointing fingers & realize, two things can be true: I was the problem & the solution,” she wrote.
Bunnie said she relied on her faith and can now see that these experiences helped shape the person she is today.
“I’m not ashamed of these photos. They remind me who I used to be, & how far grace has carried me,” she wrote.
Bunnie acknowledged that she’s still “learning” and “healing” and shared a motivational message with her followers.

“If you’re in your own rock-bottom season right now, I need you to know this- you can rebuild. You CAN rewrite your story & start believing in yourself. You are never too far gone for God to find you, love you, & lift you out,” she wrote.
After reading his wife’s vulnerable post, Jelly Roll shared a message of support in the comments.

“I would have never became the man I am with out you,” he wrote. “It was your story that inspired mine, it was always you I was trying to be like. Im glad the world is about to hear the real perseverance , and see what God can really do. While people talked about us, judged us, wished on our downfall, we just stayed the course and believed what God had for us no man could take away. We overcome by the blood of the lamb and the power of out testimony. TESTIFY BABY! TESTIFY!”

title: Surprising Couple Takes Their Final Bow After 'DWTS' Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night Elimination
summary: One more couple was eliminated on Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Night of "Dancing With the Stars." Find out who went home, the scores and more.

For the Week 8, Nov. 4 “DWTS” episode, the celebs danced to classic hits from rock ’n’ roll legends. Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee Flavor Flav joined the judges panel.
Additionally, the team dance competition returned to the ballroom, with co-hosts Alfonso Ribeiro and Julianne Hough each joining either Team Kool or Team Chicago.
Elaine Hendrix also returned to the stage after she was hospitalized last week following a rib injury that forced her to miss her performance.
The couples were also divided into teams (shared below) and danced to either a song by Kool & the Gang or Chicago for extra points.
Last week, “Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Jen Affleck and partner Jan Ravnik were eliminated after Halloween Night.

title: Andy Richter Gets Emotional Talking About the Love He's Received While On 'DWTS'
summary: Andy Richter is feeling the love as he competes on the current season of “Dancing With the Stars.”The 59-year-old comedian got emotional and teary eyed during the Nov. 4 episode, where he reflected on all the support he’s received this season.
story: Andy Richter is feeling the love as he competes on the current season of “Dancing With the Stars.”

The 59-year-old comedian got emotional and teary eyed during the Nov. 4 episode, where he reflected on all the support he’s received this season. Despite receiving the lowest scores week after week, Richter has survived due to the audience votes and his fans, known as Fandys.
For Week 8, Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night, he and partner Emma Slater danced a contemporary to “God Only Knows” by The Beach Boys.
During the rehearsal, Richter shed tears as he shared how people celebrated his birthday on Oct. 28 and made videos about it.
“There’s too many people throwing birthday parties for me,” he told Slater, his voice cracking.
In his one-on-one spot, he added, “Strangers throwing birthday parties that I wasn’t going to be at, I can’t imagine a better birthday.”
Back with Slater, he told her, “It just feels like I’m being held up and carried. It makes me want to do the steps. It makes me want to do this.”
As they embraced, he joked about getting emotional, “I cried, d--- it.”
Slater explained that their dance was in honor of their friendship. Once on the ballroom floor, the charisma and love was felt by the judges and audience.
Judge Carrie Ann Inaba said “it was a beautiful tribute” to their partnership. She also said it was “remarkable” how he is teaching people who don’t know how to dance to embrace it.
Derek Hough also thanked Richter “for embracing this process,” adding, “We’ve seen you really become something really beautiful.”
Guest judge Flavor Flav also said that they did a “real good job.”
Lastly, Bruno Tonioli called the routine, “so charming, so tender” with a “child-like honesty.” He said this has shown that Richter is  “the people’s champion.”
Ahead of getting his scores, Richter told co-host Julianne Hough that this experience “means I’m doing something right. Everything they’re saying is what I’m working on.”
He added that every week he’s trying to improve, “And I love how many people are behind us on this.”
Richter and Slater received a 30 out of 40.

title: Sydney Sweeney Breaks Her Silence on Controversial American Eagle Ad Campaign
summary: Sydney Sweeney is finally breaking her silence on the backlash over her controversial American Eagle Outfitters ad campaign earlier this year.
story: Sydney Sweeney is finally breaking her silence on the backlash over her controversial American Eagle Outfitters ad campaign earlier this year.

The “Euphoria” star, 28, was the target of online criticism after appearing in commercials for the brand that featured the tagline “Sydney Sweeney has great jeans.” The slogan — a play on the phrase “great genes” — caused many to accuse Sweeney and American Eagle of pushing harmful beauty standards that glorify white women.
Speaking to GQ magazine, Sweeney said the uproar over the ads — which grew so intense that President Donald Trump and Vice President J.D. Vance came to her defense —  ultimately “didn’t affect” her.
“I did a jean ad. I mean, the reaction definitely was a surprise, but I love jeans. All I wear are jeans. I’m literally in jeans and a T-shirt every day of my life,” said Sweeney.
Sweeney added that it was “surreal” to have Trump and Vance publicly defend her, but said she largely ignored the controversy.

“I kind of just put my phone away,” she said. “I was filming every day. I’m filming ‘Euphoria,’ so I’m working 16-hour days and I don’t really bring my phone on set, so I work and then I go home and I go to sleep. So I didn’t really see a lot of it.”

When asked about elaborating on the criticism surrounding joking about genetic superiority in the ads, Sweeney told GQ, “I think that when I have an issue that I want to speak about, people will hear.”
She went on to say she was aware that American Eagle's stock soared in the wake of her commercials and called out online rumors about “in-store visits” declining as a response to the uproar.

“It was all made up, but nobody could say anything because (the company was) in their quiet period. So it was all just a lot of talk. And because I knew at the end of the day what that ad was for, and it was great jeans, it didn’t affect me one way or the other,” she said.
On Aug. 1, American Eagle issued a statement addressing the controversy.
“'Sydney Sweeney Has Great Jeans’ is and always was about the jeans. Her jeans. Her story,” the company’s statement read.
“We’ll continue to celebrate how everyone wears their AE jeans with confidence, their way,” the company added. “Great jeans look good on everyone.”

title: Ariana Grande Pleads With Fans After Needing to Miss ‘Wicked: For Good’ Rio Premiere: ‘Please Don’t Wish Danger On Us’
summary: Ariana Grande is asking fans to be kind after she revealed she will have to miss the “Wicked: For Good” premiere in São Paulo, Brazil.
story: Ariana Grande is asking fans to be kind after she revealed she will have to miss the “Wicked: For Good” premiere in São Paulo, Brazil.

Ahead of the film’s release on Nov. 21, there are going to be multiple premieres around the world, including the first international event in the Brazilian city on Nov. 4. But a day before fans expected to see Grande, Cynthia Erivo and more cast members posing on the red carpet, the 32-year-old singer and actor announced on her Instagram story that she won’t be able to attend the premiere due to a plane issue.

“Brazil, i can’t believe this is happening and i am beyond devastated to be sending this message. a few hours ago, my team and i had to deplane our flight as they had to do maintenance on the plane due to a safety issue and it will not be taking off until 11am tomorrow which means that i would not be making it in time for the Wicked For Good São Paulo premiere,” she began in a lengthy statement posted Nov. 3. “My team and Universal have tried every single thing possible to fix this, we’ve searched every other flight, overnight, early morning, connecting flights, commercial and also private options and absolutely nothing was available or possible that would get us there in time.”
Grande said she also looked into securing a private plane permit, but it was not possible given the short notice.

“I am so heartbroken that i’m unable to be there with you all. we sincerely tried everything we could and i apologize from the bottom of my heart,” she continued. “Please shower my incredible castmates with all of the love that i wish i could be showering you with and have the most beautiful celebration. and again, i am so, so very sorry.”

But it seems that some fans were not satisfied with Grande’s explanation and apology. Hours before the São Paulo event, Grande returned to the social media platform to share another statement in which she encouraged fans to be more understanding.

“Please don’t wish danger on us. we did everything we could and i promise you no one is more upset than i am, i promise,” she wrote in a since-deleted message on her Instagram story Nov. 4 and included a heart. “No matter how upset or disappointed you are, please please do not wish danger on us or assume that we didn’t try … there was no other time for me to leave and these plans have been booked for months.”

She shared that she has had a busy schedule recently, balancing finishing another film and working “all day” the past two days. Grande also added that she was scheduled to fly to Brazil the same day as co-stars Erivo and Jonathan Bailey, as well as director Jon M. Chu, but her flight issues altered their plans.
“So please know how disappointed i am … sending lots of love to you all,” she concluded. “I hope it’s a beautiful and safe night. i love Brazil, i always have, i always will.”

Although fans won’t get to witness Glinda and Elphaba reunite in São Paulo, they’ll have other opportunities to see the duo together again this month. There will be a “Wicked: For Good” global tour, including a  premiere in Paris on Nov. 7, one in London on Nov. 10, another in Singapore on Nov. 13 and a New York City premiere on Nov. 17.

NBC is also airing a special on Nov. 6 titled “Wicked: One Wonderful Night,” featuring songs from the first movie sung by the all-star cast. The two-hour special airs at 8 p.m. ET and will steam the following day on Peacock.

The other film Grande was referring to in her post was the upcoming sequel “Focker-In-Law.” She announced on Instagram Oct. 31 that she had wrapped filming for the flick, out next November. “These past few months have been so, so unimaginably special. i love my Fockers, and i love my Byrnes… so, so very much ♡ i will miss this bunch terribly,” she captioned a series of photos that showed her with a few cast members, including Ben Stiller.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Jenna Gets Emotional As Michelle Obama Explains Why She's 'Proud' Of Her
summary: Michelle Obama and Jenna Bush Hager have an emotional heart to heart in which Michelle Obama says she's proud of Jenna.
story: Michelle Obama and Jenna are not shy about the support they have for one another.
On the Nov. 4 episode of “TODAY with Jenna & Friends,” Obama joined as a special guest to discuss her new fashion evolution book, “The Look,” among other things.
Obama shared, at the start of the chat, how proud she is of Jenna.
“I love you to death. I am so proud of you,” Obama shared, prompting Jenna to respond, "I want to cry."
"You're going to make me cry," Obama responded.

The two have a years-long connection. Obama is the wife of 44th President Barack Obama and Jenna is the daughter of 43rd President George W. Bush. As the presidency transitioned from Bush to Obama in 2008, Jenna and her twin sister, Barbara, gave the Obamas’ two daughters a tour of the White House.

"I always talk about that moment, how gracious it was for you, Barbara and your mom to take the time out to help the girls feel like it was going to be a home," Obama said. "You really made them feel loved and seen."
At the end of their chat, Obama said she is “so proud” of Jenna and Barbara “for being the gracious women that you are in the world — just showing up right every single day.”
Jenna couldn’t help but smile and tear up.
“You know, now I’m crying,” she said.
Jenna leaned in to grab Obama’s hand as the two shared a special moment.
“Thank you so, so much Mrs. Obama. You know I cry at a drop,” Jenna said. “That’s the loveliest for you to share that with me.”
The admiration went both ways. Jenna shared that she’s enjoying Obama’s podcast “IMO,” which she hosts with her brother Craig Robinson.
“I’m loving your podcast with your brother. It’s fun to be able to hear from the two of you,” Jenna said.
Jenna then mentioned Obama could make a transition into TV — after all, she’s in search of a co-host!
“There’s a spot open on this show, it seems like you’ve become good at hosting,” Jenna said.
Obama replied, laughing, “This is tricky business. These eight-minute segments drive me nuts.”
“Believe me, I know, we want more time, don't we?” Jenna said.
Obama agreed. "Always. It's a pleasure to be with you," she said.

title: Why Mariah Carey's 'It's Time' Ad for Sephora Is Sparking Backlash
summary: Mariah Carey's 2025 version of her "It's Time" video sparked backlash from fans who say it's counter to the song's theme and tone deaf.
story: Mariah Carey's love for the holiday season has always run deep, but some critics say the Queen of Christmas is taking things a bit too far this year.

On Nov. 1, the singer released a video on her Instagram page to unofficially declare that the holiday season had begun. It's become a tradition for the star in recent years, much to the delight of many Christmas lovers who are equally as eager to start celebrating.
However, this year's video doubles as an ad for a major beauty retailer, and its message is rubbing some consumers the wrong way.
Here's everything you need to know about the controversy.
What Is Mariah Carey’s ‘It’s Time’ Tradition?
Mariah Carey’s iconic hit, “All I Want for Christmas Is You,” is emblematic of the entire holiday season. Those opening notes send a message: Christmas is here.
In 2020, the singer played into the annual hype by beginning a new "It's Time" tradition.
Every year, Carey now announces the unofficial start of the holiday season on Nov. 1 in a video posted to her social media accounts.
The short videos typically show Carey transitioning from Halloween to Christmas and singing "It's time" as she hits the high notes like only she can. "All I Want for Christmas Is You" then plays.

In 2024, the "It's Time" video featured Carey dressed up as Morticia Addams from "The Addams Family." By the end of the video, she'd transformed into a winter wonderland and was ready to spread Christmas cheer.
The 2022 video showed Carey dressed as a witch while she rode a bicycle. Soon, she was in a Santa jumpsuit on top of a reindeer.
What Happens in the 2025 Version?
Carey’s “It’s Time” videos aren’t typically advertisements, but this year’s installment is an ad for Sephora.
The 2025 edition begins with Carey dressed in a white gown with angel wings.
"Halloween slayed but now it's ti..... ," she says as she begins to sing in her signature high-pitch.
However, Carey is interrupted as she notices that her bag of Sephora beauty products has been ransacked.
“Spill the tea. Who’s the thief?” she says.

Comedian Billy Eichner, dressed as an elf, walks away and says, “Busted! Bad news, Mariah Carey, the elves are striking this year. Elf revenge for putting us through holiday hell. Santa's helper quit. I'm pawning all this so I can afford elf therapy."
“That’s my blush, elf boy,” Carey quips.
"Your lipstick, I'm taking it. Christmas, it's cancelled. No bells, no cheer, no glam. Bye sweetie," Eichner says.
An indignant Carey then says, "You can't cancel Christmas."
"Any last worlds?" Eichner says.
"Yeah," Carey says. "It's time!"

As she sings, Eichner freezes and transforms into a snowman. Carey then appears dressed in a Santa-inspired ensemble, driving a sleigh. As she makes her way around the world, she drops a Sephora bag into one chimney.
Carey captioned the video with the hashtag #SephoraPartner and the words "It’s Time!!!🎄🎁."
Why Is This Year’s Video Receiving Backlash?
After watching the video on Carey’s Instagram page, some media users were thoroughly amused.
“Mariah you deserve every last bit of this check baby !!” one wrote.
Another called it “so iconic.”
Others were more critical of the ad's premise and execution, especially given the context it's landing in.
TikTok user @njml5 felt it mocked consumers who were planning to sit out Black Friday and Christmas shopping this year.

"The commercial is corny, period. But they are definitely mocking the people, working class people, who have decided, 'You know what? I'm not fueling this economy. I'm not spending all this money on Black Friday. I'm not spending all this money on Christmas fueling the economy when the economy is not fueling us,'" she said in a video.
TikTok user @millennial.mia also critiqued the ad in a post of her own, saying it was "one of the most tone deaf advertisements we have seen in this entire year."

"At a time right now where 42 million Americans aren't able to put food on the table. People who are working for the federal government are not being paid. You want to post about Mariah saving Christmas? Well, how about Mariah, actually do something about, oh I don't know, saving Christmas? Or how about you, Sephora, why don't you step in and do something charitable instead of profitable for a change?" she said.

TikTok user @nathanramospark pointed out that "All I Want for Christmas Is You" is, at its core, an "anti-capitalism song" since it talks how gifts don't matter. The song goes, "All I want for Christmas is you," after all.
"But then you have a company use this song to somehow, because it has an emotional connection, they strip it of its meaning so that they can sell literal makeup," he said.
The social media user also encouraged other Americans to tune in to what the song is supposed to mean.
"Just go back to the original meaning of the song. The original intent, that is what Christmas is about. Christmas is about sharing love and tidings of good cheer," he said.
Others were turned off by one major element of the video: a worker who wants to go on strike but is unable to do so.
“So the message here is ‘working class on strike for being overworked and underpaid gets turned into snowman and is forced to work anyway’?” one Instagram user commented.

It's worth noting that this isn’t the first time Carey and Eichner have teamed up to spread holiday cheer. In 2020, the comedian was one of several stars to appear in Carey’s Apple TV special, “Mariah Carey’s Magical Christmas Special.
In a trailer for the special, Eichner is dressed up as an elf, wearing an outfit similar to — but not exactly like — the one he wears in the 2025 "It's Time" video.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Michelle Obama Reacts to Barack Obama Telling Spectator His Wife is ‘Fine’: ‘That’s My Man’
summary: When a spectator got a little flirty with him at a recent rally in New Jersey, former President Barack Obama adorably let her know that he’s taken.
story: When a spectator got a little flirty with him at a recent rally in New Jersey, former President Barack Obama adorably let her know that he’s taken.
Obama, 64, was appearing at an event in Newark in support of Democratic gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherrill on Nov. 1 when an enthusiastic fan kept shouting his name from the crowd.
“I heard you, girl, just settle down,” he joked as the crowd laughed. “I’m here to talk to everybody, not just you. I mean, you look cute, but I am married. Michelle’s fine, too.”

Obama then made a hilarious “I’m just sayin’” face after the flattering remark about wife Michelle Obama. The former first lady shared her reaction to the cute moment while appearing Nov. 4 as a special guest on Jenna & Friends, where she spoke about her new fashion photo book, “The Look.”
“That’s my man,” she said. “He’s a cutie, too.”

Michelle, 61, also spoke about how becoming empty-nesters has reinvigorated their love for each other after being married for 33 years. Their two daughters, Sasha, 24, and Malia, 27, are now living their lives independently.

“The other part of the 60s is when your kids are launched, and it’s us, finally,” she said. “We look back at each other and go, ‘Oh, I love you, I remember you. There you are, where have you been all these years?’”
She said she enjoyed watching her husband having fun at the rally. And for the record, the feeling is mutual.
“Oh my, God, he is handsome,” she told Jenna. “He gets more handsome with age. The graying is good. He can go gray, but I’m not.”
“But yes, I think my husband is gorgeous, and he gets better with age, too.”
The former first lady said she has enjoyed the change in lifestyle that has come with turning 60 and having their children embark on their own lives.
“This is the first time in my life that every decision I’ve made is for me,” she said. “It’s freeing in a way that’s hard to describe.”

title: Jonathan Bailey Named 2025 People's Sexiest Man Alive
summary: Who is Jonathan Bailey? Find out who has been named People's Sexiest Man Alive for 2025. Here's what to know about him, his partner, his relationship with Scarlett Johansson and more.
story: The 2025 People’s Sexiest Man Alive is one wickedly good-looking guy.
During the Nov. 3 episode of “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon,” Jonathan Bailey was announced as the magazine’s sexiest man alive for this year.
The “Wicked” franchise star made an appearance during the late-night talk show, where both his covers were revealed.
“It’s an honor of a lifetime,” Bailey told host Jimmy Fallon, signing his copy of the magazine.
“Couldn’t happen to a nicer guy,” Fallon said, to which Bailey rejoiced by saying, “Every time I come here, it’s always something.”
Bailey is the first openly gay person to earn the title of People's Sexiest Man.
Bailey, who joins a long list of People’s Sexiest Man Alive alum, said he found out about earlier this year when he was doing a production of Shakespeare’s “Richard III” overseas.
“In 2025, I’m sort of thrilled that People magazine have invited someone in, to bestow this honor on someone who can really cherish the value of a sexy man,” he said.
Bailey also spoke about having his adorable dog Benson on one of the covers with him, saying, “He’s such a good boy.”
Bailey has captured hearts as Lord Anthony Bridgerton in Netflix’ period drama “Bridgerton.” He’s also starred in “Jurassic World: Rebirth" as well as “Fellow Travelers.”

His "Jurassic World" press tour sparked headlines when he shared a kiss with co-star Scarlett Johansson. “He’s a lovable guy. What can I say?” she said of the kiss on TODAY. “I don’t know. We’re just friendly people.”
Most recently, he’s embodied the dashing and swoon-worthy Fiyero in “Wicked” and the upcoming sequel “Wicked: For Good,” out Nov. 21.
During his interview, he also joked that he “f------ hopes” people treat him differently now that he’s this year’s sexiest man.
Bailey takes over the title from John Krasinski, who was crowned the magazine's Sexiest Man Alive in 2024.
The “Office” star-turned-action hero told People he thought perhaps he was being “punked” when he heard about the honor.
“That’s not how I wake up, thinking, ‘Is this the day that I’ll be asked to be Sexiest Man Alive?’ And yet it was the day you guys did it. You guys have really raised the bar for me,” he said.
Krasinski added that when his movie star wife, Emily Blunt, learned he had been named Sexiest Man Alive, she suggested they cover their home in wallpaper of his People cover.
People has been choosing its Sexiest Man Alive since 1985 when Mel Gibson became the first in a long line of famous celebs from all walks of life to win the honor.

Bailey and Krasinski follow in the footsteps of several other Hollywood actors who have been named the sexiest man in recent years, including former “Grey’s Anatomy” star Patrick Dempsey, who won the title in 2023, Marvel Cinematic Universe star Chris Evans, who won in 2022, and Paul Rudd, who was crowned in 2021.

Ahead of Bailey’s big reveal, a slew of past winners took part in a video where they “passed the phone” off to other cover stars. Dempsey kicked off the clip followed by Blake Shelton, John Legend, Harry Hamlin, Idris Elba and many others.

title: 'Dancing With the Stars' Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night: See the Full List of Songs
summary: Week 8 of “Dancing with the Stars” tips its hat to the genre of rock ’n’ roll on its Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night. See every song the couples will dance to.
story: “Dancing with the Stars” tips its hat to the genre of rock ’n’ roll on its Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night in Week 8 of the competition.
For the Nov. 4 “DWTS” episode, the remaining eight couples salute a few rock legends as they dance to hits by The Beach Boys, Bon Jovi, Elton John, the late Ozzy Osbourne and more.

The night begins with an opening number set to “Pour Some Sugar On Me” by Def Leppard and “Fight The Power” by Public Enemy choreographed by Britt Stewart. It will also feature a tour number to “Hey Ya!” by Outkast, choreographed by Mandy Moore, and a troupe dance to “Higher Ground” by Stevie Wonder.
Former Public Enemy rapper Flavor Flav, himself a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee, will appear as a guest judge during Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Night.

In a fun twist, the show's co-hosts Alfonso Ribeiro and Julianne Hough will each join one of the two teams who will dance during special live performances by Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductees Chicago and Kool & the Gang.
Then, the eight competing couples will hit the dance floor with their routines.
Last week’s “Halloween Night” episode saw the elimination of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives” star Jen Affleck and Jan Ravnik.

The episode also revealed that “Parent Trap” star Elaine Hendrix had to be hospitalized after sustaining a rib injury during rehearsals. She and pro partner Alan Bersten advanced in the competition after being judged on their taped rehearsal routine.
Read on to learn which rock songs each couple will dance to on the Tuesday, Nov. 4 episode of “Dancing With the Stars,” airing at 8 p.m. on ABC.
Alix Earle and Val Chmerkovskiy
Social media personality Earle and Chmerkovskiy will dance a paso doble to “Livin’ On a Prayer” by Bon Jovi.
Robert Irwin and Witney Carson
Wildlife conservationist Irwin and his partner Carson will perform a paso doble to “Icky Thump” by The White Stripes.
Whitney Leavitt and Mark Ballas
Leavitt, a cast member of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives,”  and pro partner Ballas will perform a paso doble to “No More Tears” by Ozzy Osbourne.
Dylan Efron and Daniella Karagach
Reality TV star Efron and his partner Karagach will perform a jive routine to “I’m Still Standing” by Elton John.
Andy Richter and Emma Slater
Comedian Richter and his partner Slater will perform a contemporary routine to “God Only Knows” by The Beach Boys.
Elaine Hendrix and Alan Bersten
Film and TV star Hendrix and Bersten will perform a Viennese waltz to “What the World Needs Now Is Love” by Dionne Warwick.
Danielle Fishel and Pasha Pashkov
Former “Boy Meets World” star Fishel and partner Pashkov will perform a contemporary routine to “Dream On” by Aerosmith.
Jordan Chiles and Ezra Sosa
Olympic gold medalist Chiles and partner Sosa will perform a jazz routine to “River Deep — Mountain High” by Ike & Tina Turner.

title: Diane Ladd, Oscar-Nominated Actor and Laura Dern's Mom, Dies at 89
summary: Diane Ladd, known for her Oscar-nominated performances in movies like “Alice Doesn’t Live Here” and mother of actor Laura Dern, has died at the age of 89.
story: Diane Ladd, known for her Oscar-nominated performances in movies like “Alice Doesn’t Live Here” and mother of actor Laura Dern, has died at the age of 89.
Dern confirmed her mother’s passing in a statement obtained by NBC News on Monday, Nov. 3.
“My amazing hero and my profound gift of a mother, Diane Ladd, passed with me beside her this morning, at her home in Ojai, (California),” Dern said.
She called her mother, “The greatest daughter, mother, grandmother, actress, artist and empathetic spirit that only dreams could have seemingly created.”
Dern added, “We were blessed to have her. She is flying with her angels now.”

Ladd appeared in hundreds of roles but was best known for her work as Flo in the 1974 film “Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore” and Marietta Fortune in the 1990 movie “Wild at Heart.” Both parts landed her Academy Award nominations for best actress in a supporting role.

The late star received another Oscar nod for her portrayal in “Rambling Rose,” the 1991 coming-of-age period drama that also starred daughter Dern in the leading role. Both mother and daughter received nominations at the 1992 Academy Awards, with Ladd competing in the supporting category and Dern being recognized in the leading role category.
Ladd was also praised for her television roles. She received Emmy nominations for her guest appearances on “Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman,” “Grace Under Fire” and “Touched by an Angel.”

Her career in Hollywood spanned eight decades. One of her many recurring roles was on the sitcom “Alice,” in which she appeared in 23 episodes according to IMDb. She also booked parts in popular movies and shows like “National Lampoon’s Christmas Vacation,” “The Love Boat,” “ER” and “Cold Case.”

More recently, she co-starred with Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper in the 2015 drama “Joy” and appeared in 46 episodes of the Hallmark Channel series “Chesapeake Shores” from 2016 to 2022. Her final role was in the 2022 drama “Isle of Hope,” according to IMDb.

Ladd was married to Bruce Dern from 1960 to 1969. She then married William A. Shea, Jr. and the two later divorced in 1976. Her third husband was former CEO of PepsiCo Food Systems Robert Charles Hunter, who died at the age of 77 in August, The Hollywood Reporter reported.

title: Craig Melvin Recalls the Adorable Way He Met Wife Lindsay at Work
summary: Craig Melvin recalled meeting wife Lindsay on air and how they started dating.
story: A producer counting down in Craig Melvin's ear during a return from a commercial break at NBC's Washington station in 2008 was unwittingly counting the seconds until Craig met his future wife.
The TODAY co-anchor recounted on Jenna & Friends on Nov. 3 how he met his wife of 14 years, Lindsay Czarniak, when the two appeared live on the air together on WRC-TV in the nation's capital.
"Back then there was no hard-launching," Craig said. "This is 2008, and I did it the old-fashioned way — I stalked her at work."
"This was when you could do that. You could meet at work. You could date at work. I knew who she was before I got there."

Lindsay had been in Beijing covering the Olympics for the network when Craig was first hired by NBC's Washington station. One day Craig was on air talking to a producer between commercials with his back turned when his future wife surprised him. She had returned from China to get back to her normal schedule.

"And I turned, and the guy filling in for her wasn't there. I didn't know that, and I turned and I'm like, 'Oh, hey, uh,' and so I got a little tongue-tied," Craig remembered. "I was like, 'Hey, welcome back from the Olympics,' and she's like, 'Welcome to Channel 4, loser. She didn't say 'loser,'" he joked.
That serendipitous moment played a role in their 2011 wedding.
"So she pulled the video for our rehearsal dinner," Craig said. "So we met on the air. I guess technically we did. We met on NBC."
Craig and Lindsay also spoke with Sheinelle Jones on TODAY in 2021 about their first meeting.
"I had just gotten back from Beijing, and he was hired," Lindsay said. "I didn't know him, but I slid in, and we met during a commercial break. And I was like, 'Who is this guy?'"
Three years later, Craig proposed to Lindsay on a boat in Miami.
The couple celebrated their 14th wedding anniversary in October and are parents of two children: Delano, 11, and Sybil, 8.

title: Mandy Moore Teases New NFL Drama from 'This Is Us' Creator Dan Fogelman
summary: Mandy Moore is reunited with Dan Fogelman of "This Is Us" for an NFL drama on Hulu.
story: It's been three years since "This Is Us" ended, but the show’s creator is hoping to strike TV magic once again with his new Hulu series.
Dan Fogelman is teaming up with Mandy Moore, who played Rebecca in "This Is Us," for an untitled football drama that also stars Christopher Meloni.
On Nov. 3, Moore shared new details about the series while appearing on “TODAY with Jenna & Friends.”
“Dan’s new show, we just started shooting it two weeks ago. It’s centered around the NFL," she said.
Moore says the show focuses on "the daughter of the owner of an NFL team," who she plays.

Moore, who runs the "That Was Us" rewatch podcast with her co-stars Sterling K. Brown and Chris Sullivan, said that she misses "This Is Us." But she's happy to be Fogelman once again and is gathering lots of knowledge about football.
“I feel like Taylor Swift. I’ve had to learn all about the NFL. I knew nothing about the NFL,” she teased.

Given the show's subject matter, Jenna Bush Hager was curious to know if Moore had talked to Charlotte Jones, who grew up as the daughter of Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones. Charlotte Jones is now a co-owner of the team.
“I did talk to Charlotte Jones,” the actor said.
“I’m a Texan, so I love her. She’s a powerhouse. Is that your role?” Jenna asked.
"Yeah. Someone who’s being primed to take over her dad when he steps down," Moore said. "It’s going to be on Hulu next year."
The 41-year-old, whose character is named Lauren Durkin, recently shared a photo from the set of the untitled series with her co-star, Meloni.
"First day of production for our new drama series created by the incredible @danfogman! See you soon on @hulu and don’t forget… football is family. 🏈🧡," she captioned the post.
William H. Macy will also star in the series as Moore's father, Hank Durkin, per Deadline. Meloni will play the team's head coach, Danny Roarke. Chace Crawford also stars as a general manager.
Moore also posted a photo of her and Meloni's chairs on set of the football drama on the first day of filming.
Fogelman is clearly psyched to work with Moore once again and sang her praises in a recent Instagram post.
"Rapunzel, then Rebecca, now Lauren. Mandy is about to crush. Again," he captioned a photo of an article announcing that the actor had joined the cast of the show.
Fogelman reunited with "This Is Us" star Sterling K. Brown for the Hulu show "Paradise," which was renewed for Season 2.

title: Rob Kardashian Just Returned to 'The Kardashians.' What Has He Been Up To?
summary: What has Rob Kardashian been up to? Where is he now? About his relationships, kids, work and return to reality TV.
story: After a long hiatus from reality TV, Rob Kardashian made a rare appearance on Season 7 of "The Kardashians."

Rob Kardashian, who is Kris Jenner's only son, reunited with his family members in Episode 2 when they all got together to say goodbye to their family home, which was featured prominently in the E! show "Keeping Up with the Kardashians."
Rob Kardashian, 38, is the youngest of the four children Kris Jenner shared with her late ex-husband, also named Robert Kardashian.
In a confessional, Kourtney Kardashian Barker revealed what it felt like to have her big brother around.
"It's nice that we can all be here together and that my brother is here," she said.
The Poosh founder then opened up about the different types of relationships that Rob Kardashian has with their siblings.

"Him and Khloé are a little incestual," she joked. "Him and Kim are like the husband and wife that hate each other. And then Rob and I, we were super close friends at one point where we would always go out together. We would always hold hands and have so much fun together. I love having him around."

Rob Kardashian has made very few appearances on "The Kardashians" in recent years. In 2016, he made his last big TV appearance on his one-season reality TV show with ex Blac Chyna called "Rob & Chyna."
Scroll below to see what Rob Kardashian is up to now.
What has Rob Kardashian been up to?
Rob Kardashian hasn't posted a picture on his official Instagram account since 2024.
However, in April 2025, Kim Kardashian shared a sweet snap of her with her brother and a few of their other family members online.

In the caption, she wished everyone a happy Easter. Then in June, Rob Kardashian made another appearance on his sister's IG account when Kim Kardashian shared a snap of them celebrating La La Anthony's birthday together.
Rob Kardashian has embarked on multiple business ventures. He launched the hot sauce brand Grandeza in 2020. However, the website is no longer active.
He also started a sock line, Arthur George, in 2012. The website is still up and running.
Is Rob Kardashian in a relationship?
Rob Kardashian opened up about his dating life during a July 2025 appearance on sister Khloé Kardashian's “Khloé in Wonder Land” podcast.
He said that he's "talking" to people.

“I’m good at talking to people. But also there (are) moments where I’m like, 'OK, I can’t talk to anybody, it’s too much energy. It’s just too much. I’m talking to too many people.' I don’t want to be like that,” he said.
Rob Kardashian’s last public relationship was with his daughter’s mother, Blac Chyna.
The couple’s relationship was documented in the E! show “Rob & Chyna.” The pair ended up breaking up in 2017 and have since been focused on raising their daughter, Dream, together.

“I’ve been single since — she’s 8 years old, I’ve been single for eight years. Of course I’ve dated and stuff, but I’ve never gotten serious or wanted to, my energy is just into Dream. I’m probably too strict with that, like I probably should have fun and enjoy my life, and I still have fun, I just don’t care to be dating somebody,” he said on the podcast.
Would Rob Kardashian return to reality TV?
On Khloé Kardashian's "Khloé in Wonder Land” podcast, he said he would be interested in returning to reality TV if the circumstance was right.
“I love filming if it’s positive and natural and I’m feeling good about myself, then of course if I’m comfortable,” he said. “I like being around my family so that stuff is good to me.”
As for why he hasn't appeared on any prior seasons of Hulu's “The Kardashians"? Rob Kardashian said it has to do with him.

“It just has everything to do with myself. I don’t want to be filming and putting myself in a position where I’m not comfortable,” he said. “I’m not comfortable in my skin so why would I want to go and be on camera and just be vulnerable and let people in when that’s not what I want to do?”

“I haven’t been comfortable with myself in years and also filming and just doing all that, it’s not for everybody. And I choose my own happiness and peace rather than filming for somebody who doesn’t do anything for me and my personal life. That’s the truth,” he added.

title: See a Full List of the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade Performers
summary: The list of performers for the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade has come out, featuring stars of "KPop Demon Hunters," Colbie Caillat and more.
story: The 99th Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade is shaping up to be one for the ages.
The roster of stars who will perform during this year’s edition of the iconic event features some names who will help make the holiday a memorable one.

More than 5,000 volunteers help get the parade off the ground, while this year’s edition will feature the debut of four new balloons, including — Buzz Lightyear from “Toy Story,” the Onion Carriage from “Shrek,” PAC-MAN and Marion from Nintendo fame. Derpy Tiger and Sussie from Netflix’s “KPop Demon Hunters” will appear as a midsized balloon and balloonicle, respectively.

“Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade is the official kickoff to the holiday season and has been part of the nation’s stories and traditions for generations,” Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade executive producer Will Coss said in a statement.

“The most wonderful stories start at the Parade. On Thanksgiving morning, larger-than-life character balloons, awe-inspiring floats and showstopping performances will create unforgettable moments and lasting holiday memories for millions of spectators in New York City and across the country.”
Who’s performing at the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?

This year’s parade will include the daytime debut of EJAE, Audrey Nuna and REI AMI, the singing voices of HUNTR/X from “KPop Demon Hunters.” There will also be performances from Broadway’s “Buena Vista Social Club,” “Just in Time” and “Ragtime.”

Other acts who will perform include Drew Baldridge, Matteo Bocelli, Colbie Caillat, Ciara, Gavin DeGraw, Meg Donnelly, Mr. Fantasy, Foreigner, Debbie Gibson, Mickey Guyton, Christopher Jackson, Jewel, Lil Jon, Kool & the Gang, Darlene Love, Roman Mejia, Taylor Momsen, Tiler Peck, Radio City Rockettes, Busta Rhymes, Calum Scott, Shaggy, Lauren Spencer Smith, Luísa Sonza and Teyana Taylor.

In addition, there will be appearances by actors Nikki DeLoach and Kristoffer Polaha, American figure skater Ilia Malinin and U.S Paralympian Jack Wallace, with “Hot Ones” host Sean Evans serving as special correspondent.
When is the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
The parade will take place Thanksgiving Day, Nov. 27 at 8:30 a.m. in all time zones.
How can I watch the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
The parade will air on NBC and can also be streamed on Peacock.
Who is hosting the 2025 Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade?
TODAY’s Savannah Guthrie and Al Roker will host, alongside former TODAY co-anchor Hoda Kotb.

title: The November 2025 Read With Jenna Pick Is the Story of a Family Curse
summary: What is the Read With Jenna November 2025 book pick? Here's the title.
story: Jenna Bush Hager says she's been a fan of Oyinkan Braithwaite since reading her debut novel, "My Sister the Serial Killer."
"Her mix of both humor and wisdom with such a fresh new perspective," she tells TODAY.com.
Which is what made her especially excited to read — and ultimately pick — Braithwaite's followup "Cursed Daughters" for her Read With Jenna book club.
"I was delighted by this book," she says.
"Cursed Daughters" follows "family of women in Lagos who believe they are not destined to love" due to a generational curse, Jenna says.
"This is a book about family, sisterhood and what it means to fall in love," Jenna says, teasing "a few epic love stories at the center."
"Cursed Daughters" by Oyinkan Braithwaite

"It is very funny at moments and extremely poignant at others. It'll have you getting a pen out to underline as I did. I think you will love this book and I hope you will share it with your daughters, your sisters, your mothers," she continues.
Speaking to TODAY, Braithwaite says she wanted to write something completely different from her bestselling debut "My Sister the Serial Killer" for her second novel.

"I had a need to challenge myself to see what I can do. I definitely didn't want to be like, 'What does "My Sister the Serial Killer" part 2 look like?'" she says. "I don't think I would have been fulfilled."

Braithwaite says her books always start with a concept that intrigues her. In the case of "Cursed Daughters," what she was drawn to was the idea of reincarnation. One character in the book is believed to be the reincarnation of her aunt, who died just as she was being born.
While Braithwaite was figuring out the family's backstory, she landed on the idea of a generational curse that says no woman will be able to "hold onto a man."
"This novel is basically about all the women who have to contend with this curse and this legacy, and the three youngest women of this family and how they deal with it," she continues.

Ebun and Monife are first cousins who go about dealing with the curse differently: Ebun runs from romance and Monife goes headfirst into it. Ebun's first-born, Eniiyi, lives in the shadow of all that went wrong for her aunt Monife.
The book also goes back many generations in the family to see how the curse presented itself — "if it was a curse" at all, Braithwaite says.
She says readers have to look forward to a bit of romance, in addition to all the deep family ties.
"I hope people ship some of the couples. Fingers crossed," she says.

title: Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo Reveal Matching Tattoos Ahead of 'Wicked: For Good' Release
summary: In a social media post shared on Grande's Instagram account, the "Wicked" actress debuted the pair's matching 'For Good' tattoos on the palm of their hands.
story: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo just commemorated their roles in "Wicked" and their lasting bond in a special way.
With just weeks left before "Wicked: For Good" premieres, the co-stars gave their followers a first look at the matching tattoos they got to celebrate the sequel.
The post, which was shared on both Grande and Erivo's Instagram pages, included two photos: one of the actors on set, and one of their sweet tattoos.

In the picture, the stars overlapped their hands, with Erivo's on top of Grande's. Both tattoos say "For Good," with Erivo opting to get hers on her left hand on the palm by her thumb. Meanwhile, Grande chose to have hers in the very center of her palm on her right hand.
The duo captioned their post with a message that read: "happy wicked month @wickedmovie ♡ 20 days."

"Wicked: For Good" is the sequel to the first "Wicked" film, and is set to be released on Nov. 21, 2025.
